logic: Project participants shall take into account the general guidance to the methodologies, information on additionality, abbreviations and general guidance on leakage provided at <http://cdm.unfccc.int/methodologies/SSCmethodologies/approved.html>.
summary: Project participants shall take into account the general guidance to the methodologies, information on additionality, abbreviations and general guidance on leakage provided at <http://cdm.unfccc.int/methodologies/SSCmethodologies/approve...

logic: This methodology is only applicable under the following conditions: (a) The livestock population in the farm is managed under confined conditions; (b) Manure or the streams obtained after treatment are not discharged into natural water resources (e.g., river or estuaries), otherwise AMS-III.H shall be applied; (c) The annual average temperature of baseline site where anaerobic manure treatment facility is located is higher than 5Â°C; (d) In the baseline scenario the retention time of manure waste in the anaerobic treatment system is greater than 1 month, and in case of anaerobic lagoons in the baseline, their depths are at least 1 m; (e) No methane recovery and destruction by flaring, combustion or gainful use takes place in the baseline scenario.
summary: This methodology is only applicable under the following conditions: (a) The livestock population in the farm is managed under confined conditions; (b) Manure or the streams obtained after treatment are not discharged into natural water r...

logic: Emission reductions under this category are estimated ex ante (ERex ante) as the difference between baseline emissions (paragraph 9) and project emissions (paragraph 17).
summary: Emission reductions under this category are estimated ex ante (ERex ante) as the difference between baseline emissions (paragraph 9) and project emissions (paragraph 17).

logic: Baseline emissions (BEy) are calculated using the amount of the waste or raw material that would decay anaerobically in the absence of the project activity, with the most recent IPCC tier

logic: For this calculation, information about the characteristics of the manure and of the management systems in the baseline is required.

logic: It is likely that the project activity involves manure treatment steps with higher methane conversion factors (MCF) than the MCF for the manure treatment systems used in the baseline situation, therefore the emission reductions achieved by the project activity is limited to the ex post calculated baseline emissions minus project emissions using the actual monitored data for the project activity (NLT,y, MS% i,y MS% l, AIl, and in case adjusted values for animal weight are used as defined in paragraph 12: VSLT,y).

logic: of measurements within the confidence level, as well as the methods and instruments used for metering, recording and processing the data obtained, shall be described in the project design document and monitored during the crediting period.

logic: The difference is considered as loss due to physical leakage and deducted from the emission reductions.
summary: The difference is considered as loss due to physical leakage and deducted from the emission reductions.

logic: If the biogas flow meter employed measures flow, pressure and temperature and displays/outputs normalised flow of biogas, there is no need for separate monitoring of pressure and temperature of the biogas.
summary: If the biogas flow meter employed measures flow, pressure and temperature and displays/outputs normalised flow of biogas, there is no need for separate monitoring of pressure and temperature of the biogas.

logic: defined as the fraction of time in which the gas is combusted in the flare, multiplied by the efficiency of the flaring process, shall be monitored.
summary: defined as the fraction of time in which the gas is combusted in the flare, multiplied by the efficiency of the flaring process, shall be monitored.

logic: One of the two following options shall be used to determine the efficiency of the flaring process in an enclosed flare: (a) To adopt a 90% default value or (b) To perform a continuous monitoring of the efficiency.
summary: One of the two following options shall be used to determine the efficiency of the flaring process in an enclosed flare: (a) To adopt a 90% default value or (b) To perform a continuous monitoring of the efficiency.

logic: 4 If the biogas flared and fuelled (or utilized) are continuously monitored separately, the two fractions can be added to determine the biogas recovered.
